hits.title: mSchools Changing Education Together
hits.description:
Attention: All content for this session will be in Catalan.
 
Experience mSchools' annual Changing Education Together conference, this year's theme is "Technology and Education at the Service of People". We look forward to seeing you there!
The session brings together the education and tech communities to reflect on how technology can contribute to a more ethical, sustainable and relevant education for society.
 
Agenda:
 
10:00am - mSchools: A platform to connect opportunities
A journey through the role of mSchools as a nexus between technology, society and education, contributing to a more inclusive, equitable and adapted education to current needs. This session highlights the present and future of an initiative committed to social and educational impact.
 
10:20am - A digital education centered on people - Liliana Arroyo + Genís Roca
This dialogue will reflect on how education must be a fundamental pillar for progress that leaves no one behind in a world marked by uncertainty and constant change. In a context of accelerated technological transformation, values ​​such as ethics, critical thinking and humanism will be highlighted as keys to ensuring that education responds not only to the needs of society and the economy, but also to the training of committed citizens prepared to adapt to the challenges of the future.
 
10:50am - Innovative solutions for current educational challenges - Francesc Fajula + Dra Rosa Bosch
Discover how the mSchools Lab is addressing educational challenges through innovative solutions. The progress of the winning initiatives of the first challenge that work to improve motivation and personalization of learning will be shared, and the new challenge focused on early detection and addressing learning difficulties and socio-emotional support will be presented.
 
11:20am - Leadership of change from educational centers - Coral Regí + Núria Sabaté + Laura Serrats
This blog will bring together three school principals who will share their experiences managing and promoting educational innovation. Based on the reflections of the mSchools Dialogues with Xavier Marcet, Iolanda Batallé and Carlos Iglesias, they will share ideas for adapting schools to the changing needs of the current context.
 
11:50am - A collective commitment for education
We will close the day with an invitation to the entire educational community to work together to build a more inclusive and connected education, where technology serves to strengthen pedagogical practice and opportunities for everyone.

title.value: mSchools Changing Education Together

hits.title: From Materials to Machines: How C12 is Redefining Quantum Computing
hits.description: C12, a Paris-based quantum computing startup, is revolutionizing the field with its unique use of carbon nanotubes as the core building block for scalable, error-corrected quantum processors. In this talk, Pierre Desjardins, CEO and Co-Founder of C12, will share how the company combines ultra-pure materials with semiconductor technology to overcome the limitations of traditional quantum computing approaches. Launched in 2020 as a spin-off from École Normale Supérieure’s physics lab, C12 has already secured €25M in funding, a team of 47 experts, and 8 patents. The presentation will highlight the disruptive potential of C12's technology to unlock large-scale quantum computing and explore how this innovation is poised to solve the most complex challenges across industries, creating opportunities for investors to be part of the quantum revolution.

title.value: From Materials to Machines: How C12 is Redefining Quantum Computing

hits.title: Intelligence Hour: MWC 2025 in Review - What’s the Role of OSS/BSS in Powering the Show’s Top Themes?

sponsors.name: GSMA Intelligence
sponsors.description:
GSMA Intelligence is the definitive source of global mobile operator data, analysis and forecasts, and publisher of authoritative industry reports and research. Our data covers every operator group, network and MVNO in every country worldwide, encompassing over 350+ metrics and 50 million+ individual datapoints . This data drives a rich research product, benefitting from unparalleled insights into operator demands, strategies, and business models. 

As the market has evolved, so too has GSMA Intelligence research and data. 5G and IoT forecasts, extending out to 2030, have been built, powered by a team of respected industry analysts and data experts who use their deep understanding of mobile markets, technologies and regulatory issues to identify trends and topics that are shaping the fast-moving industry. 

While continuing to power flagship research series such as the Mobile Economy series, the team’s syndicated research now spans more than 200 reports a year, including custom deliverables focused on specific customer needs.

hits.description:
Across four days of sessions, summits and Executive Roundtables, MWC25 will telegraph the tehnologies and trends guiding the market for the year to come. But, whether technical or strategic in nature, these conversations often leave a key question unanswered: the role of OSS and BSS innovations in enabling broader mobile ecosystem opportunities.
Join us on the last day of MWC25 where operations and billing execs will look back on the show's themes - including 5G monetization, NTN solutions, and AI - and weigh in on the role OSS/BSS solutions play in making them a reality.

title.value: Intelligence Hour: MWC 2025 in Review - What’s the Role of OSS/BSS in Powering the Show’s Top Themes?

hits.title: GSMA Advance: Accrediting for Impact

sponsors.name: GSMA Advance
sponsors.description:
The learning and skills division of the GSMA, we provide industry-first professional accreditations and tailored training to organizations and their workforce.

At GSMA Advance, we offer the mobile industry’s first professional accreditations and tailored training designed to help you and your team stay ahead. Plus, if you’re registered for MWC Barcelona 2025, you’ll get 15% off the full price of any GSMA Advance course. 

https://www.gsmaadvance.com/

hits.description: This session focuses on GSMA's Accreditation and Training arm, GSMA Advance. Our Accreditations and courses are created by our subject matter experts, distilling decades of expertise, insight and impact in the mobile ecosystem to help our members and the wider ecosystem close skills gaps and build resilience. We will hear how GSMA is investing in its own staff through GSMA Advance's training, the genesis of GSMA Advance and the feedback we receive from members, and from our curriculum experts on why they created the course and what they want our members to gain from it.

title.value: GSMA Advance: Accrediting for Impact

hits.description: The direct-to-consumer revolution is upending traditional digital fan engagement. Join us as we will dive deep into how the sports media and entertainment is transforming.  Using data-driven personalization and innovative partnerships learn how leading companies are enhancing the fan experience on and off the field as never before.Discover the cutting-edge strategies for staying connected to fans during and between games. hits.title: Sports and Entertainment Summit: Bundling Is The Game: How Telcos Power Sports & Entertainment Subscriptions
hits.description:
As streaming giants like Amazon Prime Video and YouTube invest in live sports, the intersection of mobile technology, sports, and entertainment is reshaping how fans access their favorite content. From Champions League to NFL Thursday Night Football, bundling is emerging as a key strategy, with telcos playing a pivotal role in delivering these experiences.
Join Bango, Amazon, and YouTube to explore exclusive first-party data on subscribers, revealing spending behaviors, subscription patterns, and the growing importance of telco channels in driving reach and retention. This session dives into the transformative power of telco-led bundling and its impact on the future of sports and entertainment.
 
This Panel is part of the Sports and Entertainment Summit afternoon session:
 
Full Afternoon Agenda
12:30 – 12:50: Keynote "Mobile Fan Experience: Turning Passion into Business Intelligence" by Vladimir Liulka, Founder & CEO of Blocksport. Learn more HERE
12:50 – 13:20: Panel Discussion: "Immersive and Emerging Technologies Reshaping the Sports and Entertainment Landscape" moderated by Faisal Zia, GSMA, and joined by Marko Jovanovic of Ericsson, Jan Wedekind of King, Samir Ceric of Blocksport and Barry Dubovsky of Mondia. Learn more HERE

hits.title: University & Spin off Programme: Deep Science for Deep Impact
hits.description:
Dive into high-tech fields where science-driven innovation is essential for progress.
This session showcases trailblazing companies at the forefront of quantum technology, advanced AI, new materials, and other cutting-edge innovations transforming industries such as chemistry, physics, biotechnology, and telecommunications. These fields require groundbreaking science and visionary leadership to address critical global challenges.
Gain valuable insights into how these companies are harnessing deep-tech solutions to drive sustainable and meaningful impact.

title.value: University & Spin off Programme: Deep Science for Deep Impact

hits.title: University & Spin off Programme: Lessons from DeepTech Spin Off Leaders
hits.description:
Gain valuable insights into the journey from academic research to entrepreneurial success. Hear from founders and researchers who have successfully transitioned their scientific breakthroughs into impactful deeptech businesses. This session will feature candid stories about the challenges and milestones faced along the way, offering practical takeaways for aspiring entrepreneurs interested in the spin-off pathway.
Join a panel of accomplished spin-off leaders as they share practical lessons on scaling science-based ventures in the innovation landscape. Topics will include commercialization strategies, industry partnerships, and the unique challenges spin-offs face in deep-tech fields.

title.value: University & Spin off Programme: Lessons from DeepTech Spin Off Leaders

hits.title: University & Spin off Programme: Impact of European Research Hubs in the DeepTech Innovation
hits.description:
Learn about the pivotal role European research hubs play in fostering innovation and supporting the journey from lab to market, based on a Joint Research Center study, which in the framework of the European TTO Circle (G-35 of Tech Transfer Offices), aims at delving into the potential that deep tech entrepreneurship has to transform the existing technological excellence in Europe into prosperity. 
E.g. articulating new value chains that could reindustrialize European regions and/or help diversify into higher value added markets industrial companies; creating high quality jobs in deep tech start-ups; ultimately ensuring the strategic autonomy of Europe and addressing the grand societal challenges of our time), thus, benefiting our economy and society.

title.value: University & Spin off Programme: Impact of European Research Hubs in the DeepTech Innovation

This session explores the evolving challenges of online harassment, the societal and psychological impact, and the role of technology in prevention and mitigation.

hits.title: Data, AI and connectivity: Revolutionizing mobility and transportation

From optimizing urban transportation networks to enabling autonomous and connected vehicles, emerging technologies are reshaping how people and goods move.This session will explore how AI-powered data insights, real-time connectivity, and mobility innovations are creating smarter, more efficient, and sustainable transportation systems. Join industry leaders as they discuss the key challenges, breakthroughs, and future trends shaping the next generation of mobility.

title.value: Data, AI and connectivity: Revolutionizing mobility and transportation

hits.title: Not Another AI Talk: The Human Side of AI Innovation
hits.description:
In this session, Enrique Linares and Jorge Araujo will interview Álvaro Martínez Higes, Co-Founder & CEO of Luzia—an AI assistant launched in April 2023 that has already reached 50 million users in over 40 countries, raised over 30 million euros in funding, and ranked #25 among the top 100 generative AI apps by Andreessen Horowitz.
While most AI talks focus on the tech itself, here we’ll dive into personal journeys, human challenges, and the vision behind creating a product that’s redefining how we interact with technology. Join us for an honest conversation on balancing rapid growth, relentless innovation, and the realities of life as a founder in the fast-paced AI landscape.

title.value: Not Another AI Talk: The Human Side of AI Innovation

hits.title: The Road to Exit Amid the IPO Dry Spell
hits.description: In 2024, global IPO volumes fell 10% according to EY. This "IPO dry spell" has left many founders grappling with limited public market opportunities for exits. However, alternative pathways—such as strategic acquisitions, private equity deals, and secondary sales—are emerging as viable options. This panel will explore the current state of the exit landscape, highlight success stories from founders navigating these challenges, and provide insights into what lies ahead for those looking to transition in a challenging market environment.

title.value: The Road to Exit Amid the IPO Dry Spell

hits.title: Sports and Entertainment Summit: Immersive Experiences - The Convergence of Sports, Entertainment and Gaming
hits.description:
Technology is transforming the landscape of sports, entertainment, and gaming, creating unprecedented immersive experiences for fans and players alike. This session will explore how cutting-edge innovations are reshaping these industries, both at live events and in the digital realm. 
In stadiums and venues worldwide, connectivity solutions are revolutionizing the fan journey from "driveway to driveway." Mobile apps now provide real-time updates on travel, parking, and queuing times, while frictionless payment systems streamline transactions. Sharing special moments with those not in attendance has become integral, with US stadiums reporting record-breaking data usage at major events like Taylor Swift concerts. For at-home viewers, advanced on-screen graphics and AI-driven insights are elevating the virtual fan experience.
Meanwhile, gaming is experiencing exponential growth, with 58% of adults playing weekly across devices. Mobile and cloud gaming are fueling this surge, with cloud gaming expected to grow from $2.4 billion in 2024 to $8.2 billion by 2025. Innovations like XR, cross-platform play, and esports are redefining engagement, while AI is unlocking new possibilities in game design and player interactivity.
As technology continues to redefine fan engagement across industries, organisations must harness these innovations to build stronger connections and optimise business strategies.
This is the focus of our keynote presentation: Vladimir Liulka, Founder & CEO of Blocksport, will explore how a mobile Superapp, powered by a Consumer Data Platform (CDP), is revolutionizing fan engagement. Discover how consolidating multiple touchpoints enables organizations to collect and analyze fan data while maintaining direct audience relationships. Learn how this integrated approach enhances personalisation, boosts revenue, and strengthens marketing—all with full data ownership. The session will feature real-world case studies, including Blocksport’s work with Deutsche Telekom and Telekom Baskets Bonn, showcasing the business impact of data-driven fan engagement.
Our afternoon panel, "Immersive and Emerging Technologies Reshaping the Sports and Entertainment Landscape", will explore how immersive experiences are redefining audience interaction across these sectors and discuss how XR is transforming fan engagement, entertainment, and gaming. 
Full Afternoon Agenda
12:30 – 12:50: Keynote "Mobile Fan Experience: Turning Passion into Business Intelligence" by Vladimir Liulka, Founder & CEO of Blocksport
12:50 – 13:20: Panel Discussion: "Immersive and Emerging Technologies Reshaping the Sports and Entertainment Landscape" moderated by Faisal Zia, GSMA, and joined by Marko Jovanovic of Ericsson, Samir Ceric of Blocksport and Barry Dubovsky of Mondia.
13:20 - 13:50: Panel Discussion: "Bundling Is The Game - How Telcos Power Sports & Entertainment Subscriptions". Learn more HERE
13:50 - Closing Remarks by Faisal Zia
14:00 - Event Close 
Join us to explore how technological advancements are creating more immersive and engaging experiences across sports, entertainment, and gaming.

title.value: Sports and Entertainment Summit: Immersive Experiences - The Convergence of Sports, Entertainment and Gaming

hits.title: Sports and Entertainment Summit: How Mobile Tech is Transforming the Sport and Entertainment Vertical
hits.description:
The 2025 Sports and Entertainment Summit will showcase the transformative power of mobile technology in sport, entertainment, and gaming. Explore pivotal trends, groundbreaking innovations, and real-world solutions that are driving industry growth, while discovering the technologies and strategies shaping the future of these dynamic sectors.
As fans increasingly demand seamless connectivity at live events, the way venues, teams, and content creators engage audiences is being redefined. The ability to share moments in real-time, access updates, and interact with content has made robust wireless connectivity essential to delivering unforgettable experiences.
This session will explore how innovations such as 5G, C-band, and mobile edge computing are meeting these challenges. Technologies like Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS)—which handle skyrocketing data traffic, with stadiums reporting a 67% year-on-year increase—are revolutionising connectivity. Small cell deployments enable frictionless mobile ticketing, while mobile edge computing enhances real-time data processing, delivering smarter and more efficient solutions. 
The morning panel discussion, 'How Mobile Tech is Transforming the Sport and Entertainment Vertical,' will be moderated by Roy Chua, Founder and Principal at AvidThink, and joined by Leo Matytsine, Co-founder and EVP of MatSing and Tuula Tomminen, Head of Product Marketing, Strategy and Technology, Nokia and Mahmoud ElSakhawy, Division Manager, E2E performance and Capacity Business Unit Head at Rakuten Mobile, Inc.Agenda
10.00 - 10.30: Knowledge Partner Accenture - Panel Discussion: The Future of D2C Fan Engagement. Learn more HERE
10:30 – 10:45: Opening Remarks and Industry Insights by Tim Hatt, Head of Research, GSMAi
10:45 – 11:00: Keynote by Marko Jovanovic, Head of Marketing, Strategy and Insights for Europe and Latam, Ericsson
11:00 – 11:30: Panel Discussion: "How Mobile Tech is Transforming the Sport and Entertainment Vertical" moderated by Roy Chua of AvidThinkJoin us to discover how venues worldwide are adopting these advanced mobile technologies to deliver world-class experiences that exceed fan expectations.
Networking Opportunity: The summit kicks off with a networking event on Wednesday, 17:00–18:00—a relaxed setting to connect with industry leaders, innovators, and peers. The event will feature an inspiring presentation by Matsing, providing invaluable insights to set the stage for the discussions ahead.

title.value: Sports and Entertainment Summit: How Mobile Tech is Transforming the Sport and Entertainment Vertical

hits.title: AI for Everyone: A Conversation on Sovereignty, Ethics, and Open Source
hits.description: As artificial intelligence continues to reshape industries and societies, questions of ethical responsibility, sovereignty, and technological accessibility are more critical than ever. This session will explore the intersection of AI innovation, open-source development, and ethical considerations, delving into how advancements in chip production, infrastructure, and collaborative AI models can drive inclusivity and global progress.The discussion will tackle pressing issues such as data sovereignty, the role of open-source AI in democratizing access, transparency in AI decision-making, and the challenges of building systems that are not only powerful but also trustworthy and fair.

title.value: AI for Everyone: A Conversation on Sovereignty, Ethics, and Open Source

hits.title: Building Inclusive Startups: Advancing Diversity, Equity, and Belonging in Tech
hits.description: The tech and startup ecosystems are key drivers of innovation, but how can they become more inclusive? This panel brings together diverse perspectives to discuss the current landscape of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) in tech. Our speakers will explore the opportunities and challenges of fostering truly inclusive environments. From supporting the LGBTQ+ community to empowering individuals with disabilities, this session aims to share practical insights for leaders striving to create workplaces where everyone feels they belong.

title.value: Building Inclusive Startups: Advancing Diversity, Equity, and Belonging in Tech

hits.title: FT Session @ MWC Barcelona
hits.description:
The rapid evolution of transformative technologies like AI, 5G, edge and quantum computing is forcing enterprises to reimagine how they operate, innovate and compete. Agility has become a defining trait of successful organisations, as they navigate accelerating change and rethink traditional business models. From streamlining internal processes to embracing emerging technologies such as blockchain and computer vision, companies are making bold investments in their digital strategies to secure a competitive edge. 
 
How can enterprises leverage digital agility to not only adapt but thrive in this era of disruption? What best practices are emerging for organisations to continuously evolve and stay ahead of the curve?
 
This discussion, held during Mobile World Congress 2025, will explore the strategies businesses are employing to ensure resilience and gain a decisive edge in the rapidly evolving digital landscape. It will discuss actionable insights and best practices, spotlighting the critical role of leadership and strategic foresight whilst balancing the pace of innovation.
 
-   How can enterprises identify the right mix of emerging technologies to prioritise for their industry?
-   What does digital agility mean in practice, and how can companies embed it into their culture?
-   What role does leadership play in steering enterprises through technological transformations?
-   How can enterprises maintain a competitive edge while ensuring ethical and responsible use of technology?
-   What role do collaboration and partnerships play when driving innovation and adoption at scale?

title.value: FT Session @ MWC Barcelona

hits.title: The Search Wars: The Race for AI-Powered Search Dominance
hits.description: AI is changing search, turning it from a tool for finding information into a powerful, interactive experience. In this session, we’ll look at how big tech companies are competing to lead in AI search, the privacy and bias challenges they face, and what this means for everyday users and industries like digital marketing and SEO.

title.value: The Search Wars: The Race for AI-Powered Search Dominance

hits.title: Under Siege: Fortifying Data Security in the Global Tech Landscape
hits.description:
In an era where 90% of the world's data has been created in the last two years alone, safeguarding sensitive information has become a critical priority for the global tech industry. This session delves into the unique data security challenges faced by the telecommunications, vertical industries, and AI sectors, focusing on protecting data storage systems and fortifying cybersecurity frameworks.
 
Join industry leaders and experts as they explore the latest trends in combating cyber threats, discuss the impact of AI-driven innovations on data protection, and examine how global collaboration can enhance resilience against breaches. Discover actionable strategies to secure data across borders in a connected, fast-evolving tech landscape.

title.value: Under Siege: Fortifying Data Security in the Global Tech Landscape

hits.title: Showcase: Moonshot Minds
hits.description:
In this visionary session, thought leaders and innovators take the stage to share bold ideas and groundbreaking perspectives on the future of technology. From transformative innovations to creative applications of emerging technologies, this session explores how ambitious ideas—“moonshots”—are driving progress across industries and society.
 
Join us as we uncover how these pioneers are leveraging technology to solve global challenges, inspire new ways of thinking, and lay the foundation for a future defined by innovation, impact, and possibility.

title.value: Showcase: Moonshot Minds

hits.title: AI for Good Innovation Factory - Catalonia
hits.description:
The AI for Good Innovation Factory is coming to Barcelona on March 6th, 2025!   
The AI for Good Innovation Factory is a global startup competition led by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU), the United Nations specialized agency for digital technology, to find the most promising AI solutions that support the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).  
Hosted by the Government of Catalonia and coordinated by DCA-IA and CIDAI inside the MWC25, the AI for Good Innovation Factory - Catalonia will bring together innovative minds, offering a platform for Catalan startups to showcase their AI-driven solutions that address global challenges. 
FIND OUT MORE
 
ABOUT AI FOR GOOD INNOVATION FACTORY  
The AI for Good Innovation Factory is the leading UN-led platform designed to help start-ups grow and scale their AI-powered, SDG-driven solutions. By connecting innovators with potential business partners, investors, governments, and large tech companies, this initiative fosters collaborations that drive positive global change.  
For those seeking ground-breaking solutions from startups, the AI for Good Innovation Factory offers a unique opportunity to engage with ventures that combine innovation with a commitment to social impact. Join us as we continue to support transformative AI projects, leading up to the Grand Finale in Geneva during the United Nations’ AI for Good Global Summit 2025. 
 
ABOUT THE ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE STRATEGY OF CATALONIA – CATALONIA.AI  
The Government of Catalonia promotes the Artificial Intelligence Strategy of Catalonia – Catalonia.AI – to strengthen the AI ecosystem by fostering knowledge and talent generation, encouraging technological adoption in the business sector, and driving the development of innovative solutions, always considering ethical principles and legal requirements.

title.value: AI for Good Innovation Factory - Catalonia

hits.title: Identity Security in Action: How Telecoms are Fighting Fraud while Reducing Customer Friction
hits.description:
Identity fraud is skyrocketing, and telecoms are prime targets. With fraudsters using AI to exploit vulnerabilities, how can providers protect customers without adding friction?
Join Nick Bednarz (Rogers Communications & Rogers Bank) and David Mahdi (Transmit Security, former Gartner VP Analyst) for a dynamic discussion on combating Telecom fraud, including SIM swaps, ATOs, synthetic identities, and more. Learn how telecoms are balancing security with seamless customer experiences—and what the future holds in an AI-driven world.
Agenda: 🔹 The Fraud Landscape – Top threats & AI-driven fraud tactics 🔹 Fighting Fraud Without Friction – Real-world strategies for telecoms 🔹 The Future of Identity Security – How to stay ahead in 2025 and beyond
Q&A – Ask the experts & get actionable insights

title.value: Identity Security in Action: How Telecoms are Fighting Fraud while Reducing Customer Friction

hits.title: Decoding the AI stack  and how to succeed in the AI value chain
hits.description:
Join us for an engaging session exploring the opportunities and challenges across the AI value chain.
From groundbreaking advancements in quantum computing and AI to transformative use cases across industries, our panel of leading academics, researchers, and CMS AI experts will discuss emerging trends and legal implications shaping the AI landscape.
 
The CMS International Tech, Media and Telecommunications (TMC) team has considerable expertise across AI, Machine Learning and large language models, working with some of the largest businesses in AI, with decades of knowledge of the Communications space.
 
We are keen to share our thoughts about AI and to add to the wider AI debate. CMS has a long history of advising companies large and small to leverage the benefits of new technology including AI developments whilst limiting the possible legal risks.
 
Find out more about our expertise and content related to AI on our webpage: Artificial Intelligence law firm | CMS

title.value: Decoding the AI stack  and how to succeed in the AI value chain

hits.title: Engineering Tomorrow: Key Considerations in Network-Integrated Device Design
hits.description: This session will explore the foundational considerations driving the next wave of networked devices, from ensuring seamless connectivity and enhanced security to advancing sustainability and interoperability. What considerations manufacturers are making as they develop their next major products?

title.value: Engineering Tomorrow: Key Considerations in Network-Integrated Device Design

hits.title: Rethinking Supply Chains: How Tech Can Clean Up It’s Act
hits.description: With the World Economic Forum reporting that circular models could generate $4.5 trillion in economic benefits by 2030, telecoms are rethinking their supply chains, device lifecycles, and e-waste management. By refurbishing, recycling, and reusing equipment, and minimizing resource extraction, telecom operators are lowering their carbon footprints while fostering long-term value. This shift toward sustainable operations reflects a broader global commitment to reducing environmental impact and creating a more resilient, regenerative economy.

title.value: Rethinking Supply Chains: How Tech Can Clean Up It’s Act

hits.title: MWC 25: What Did We Learn?
hits.description:
If you attend MWC 2025, or even follow it from afar, it’s because you know MWC is the one event that brings together innovators, business leaders and some of the most prominent figures in connectivity to discuss the future of mobility and the breadth of opportunities across the mobile ecosystem. From AI and 5G, to cloud and enterprise digital transformation, it’s all on display. 
 
And yet, at the end of a busy event full of demos, business meetings, networking, and enlightening summits, it’s easy to miss the bigger picture, leaving you wondering... 
 
Which new technologies and trends seem to be gaining momentum, and which ones are lagging? 
 
Which announcements were exciting? 
 
What was surprising and what was expected? 
 
What did we learn this year? 
 
These are the exact questions industry analysts try to address for their customers. At the close of MWC 2025, join us as we convene some of the smartest expert industry analysts to share their thoughts on what happened during the week and what it means for the rest of the year.

title.value: MWC 25: What Did We Learn?

hits.title: The End of the 'G' Era? Rethinking Connectivity
hits.description: Advancements in AI, cloud, and edge computing are driving the evolution of networks into programmable and self-evolving systems, challenging the traditional notion of “G” generations. So does this mean that this could also mark the end of distinct generational leaps?

title.value: The End of the 'G' Era? Rethinking Connectivity

hits.title: Majority Report: Balancing Safety and Surveillance
hits.description: As digital identity evolves, from blockchain IDs to iris scans, the balance between safety and surveillance grows complex. Let’s learn how these technologies combat fraud and theft while addressing privacy, data control, and ethical concerns, striving for a future that upholds security and individual rights.

title.value: Majority Report: Balancing Safety and Surveillance

hits.title: University & Spin off Programme: Spin off Pitch Battle
hits.description:
Meet the top 4 spin-offs coming from our bustling university ecosystem and watch them pitch on stage to investors to become winner of the 4YFN 2025 Spin Off Pitch battle!
 
The finalists spin-offs are:
- AIMS Medical
- RFIoT
- NIMBLE Diagnostics
- LogMeal
 
The jury will be composed of experienced partners of VC firms investing in deeptech and early stage:
- Laura Raggl, Managing Partner, ROI Ventures
- Dong Su Kim, CEO, LG Tech Ventures
- Rick Hao, Partner, SpeedInvest

title.value: University & Spin off Programme: Spin off Pitch Battle

hits.description:
Unveiling the winner of the Pitch Battle between the top 4 startups of the University & Spin off hub.
Before the announcement, ColorSensing, the winning spinoff of the 2024 Pitch Battle, will update us on their progress over the past year and their upcoming milestones.

title.value: University & Spin off Programme: Pitch Battle Winner Announcement

hits.title: University & Spin off Programme: How to Bridge the Gap between Research and the Innovation Ecosystem
hits.description:
Unlock the potential of academic research by exploring the critical elements that support science-based entrepreneurship. How Universities, Corporates, and Research Hubs Shape Spin-Off Success?
Discover the essential roles that universities, research institutions, corporates, and investors play in creating a robust ecosystem for spin-offs. We will explore successful models of university-industry collaboration, knowledge transfer frameworks, and strategies that foster impactful innovation. This discussion also highlights global perspectives on innovation ecosystems, offering comparisons that reveal different approaches to nurturing science-based entrepreneurship.

title.value: University & Spin off Programme: How to Bridge the Gap between Research and the Innovation Ecosystem

hits.title: Corporate Innovators Programme: Business Prototyping: Test, Learn, and Succeed
hits.description:
Innovation speed is everything in today’s business world. This session dives into how rapid prototyping helps companies test ideas, refine strategies, and reduce risks. Discover real cases on how industry leaders are using business prototyping models to de-risk decisions, foster creativity, and achieve faster go-to-market success.
 
Panel Discussion:

Moderator: Blai Carandell, Partner & CEO, Noba Ventures
David Cazorla Jäggin, SVP North America, Henkel
Asli Raman, Technology Transfer and Business Development Manager, Institute for Bioengineering of Catalonia (IBEC)
Ernesto Aguiar Vaca, Head of Tastech by Sigma, Sigma

title.value: Corporate Innovators Programme: Business Prototyping: Test, Learn, and Succeed

hits.title: Corporate Innovators Programme: Unlocking the Power of AI in Open Innovation: Best Practices for Collaborations
hits.description:
This session examines how AI enables more effective joint innovation efforts, exploring successful collaborative models and real-world case studies. Discover the strategies and tools that unlock the potential of AI in open innovation, fostering partnerships that deliver transformative results.
